questions.explanation:
7. Who's covering for Ms. Hamada?
(A) Yes, it may rain later. → Incorrect (unrelated to covering for Ms. Hamada)
(B) No, I have enough. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Her assistant. → Correct (identifies who is covering for Ms. Hamada)

8. Where is the fashion seminar?
(A) It's in room 235. → Correct (specifies the location of the seminar)
(B) No, the black one. → Incorrect (unrelated to the seminar location)
(C) Just some blouses. → Incorrect (refers to clothing, not location)

9. Why do we have to put on safety goggles?
(A) No, the door on your left. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)
(B) Because of safety regulations. → Correct (explains the reason for wearing goggles)
(C) A hat and a scarf. → Incorrect (unrelated to safety goggles)

10. What did you do for Mr. Sugiyama's retirement party?
(A) I helped decorate the room. → Correct (describes contribution to the party)
(B) He's not tired. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'retirement')
(C) Try the file cabinet. → Incorrect (unrelated to the party)

11. Can I take another bottle of water?
(A) If there are any left. → Correct (addresses availability of water)
(B) An old refrigerator. → Incorrect (unrelated to water bottles)
(C) No, the clock is fast. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Isn't this the last train out?
(A) A round-trip ticket to New York. → Incorrect (refers to ticket type, not train schedule)
(B) The office next door. → Incorrect (unrelated to the train)
(C) No, there's one more. → Correct (confirms another train exists)

13. What was the highlight of your visit to the city this weekend?
(A) Definitely the art museum! → Correct (identifies the highlight of the visit)
(B) Sorry, I already have plans. → Incorrect (unrelated to the visit)
(C) Yes, the guidebook was helpful. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the highlight)

14. When was that news story about the merger published?
(A) A few weeks ago. → Correct (specifies the publication time)
(B) A reporter from the Springfield News. → Incorrect (refers to the reporter, not time)
(C) No, I think that's the right address. → Incorrect (unrelated to publication)

15. We need to install a security system at the office.
(A) It's a new ID badge. → Incorrect (unrelated to security system installation)
(B) Yes, I think that's a good idea. → Correct (agrees with the suggestion)
(C) I bought some lightbulbs. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. Where are the job fairs being held?
(A) I'll take seven of them. → Incorrect (unrelated to location)
(B) There's a list in the folder. → Correct (points to where location information can be found)
(C) OK, I can drive. → Incorrect (refers to transportation, not location)

17. When can we use the new color printer?
(A) This afternoon. → Correct (specifies when the printer can be used)
(B) OK, that's good to hear. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated to timing)
(C) Sure, I can take a photograph. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the printer)

18. Could you order some more paper plates?
(A) Thanks for the invitation. → Incorrect (unrelated to paper plates)
(B) He got a job at the restaurant. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)
(C) We have enough for three months. → Correct (addresses the need for more plates)

19. Should I pick up the food order for Ms. Santos?
(A) Let's meet next week. → Incorrect (unrelated to the food order)
(B) Yes, if you have the time. → Correct (agrees to picking up the order)
(C) I don't cook with vegetable oil. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

20. Why don't you distribute this flyer around the office?
(A) Sure—that's a great idea. → Correct (agrees to distribute the flyer)
(B) Our flight's been canceled. → Incorrect (unrelated to the flyer)
(C) I'll take the elevator. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. How often do you go to concerts?
(A) I ride my bicycle to work every day. → Incorrect (unrelated to concerts)
(B) No, he's not a professional musician. → Incorrect (irrelevant to frequency)
(C) I don't have a lot of free time. → Correct (implies infrequent concert attendance)

22. Do you want me to fix the printer in your office?
(A) An official document. → Incorrect (unrelated to fixing the printer)
(B) Yes, that would be helpful. → Correct (accepts the offer to fix the printer)
(C) I printed it on both sides. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

23. Will the company's warehouse be built in the city or farther out?
(A) It'll be in the city. → Correct (specifies the warehouse location)
(B) Yes, he's wearing a red sweater. → Incorrect (unrelated to the warehouse)
(C) Two square kilometers. → Incorrect (refers to size, not location)

24. The taxi has finally arrived.
(A) Oh, did it get stuck in traffic? → Correct (relevant response to the taxi's arrival)
(B) Thanks, but I already have some. → Incorrect (unrelated to the taxi)
(C) It's their final offer. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the arrival)

25. How can we train all the new team members?
(A) Yes, I worked on those. → Incorrect (unrelated to training method)
(B) It wasn't as long as we thought. → Incorrect (irrelevant to training)
(C) People like watching videos. → Correct (suggests a training method)

26. The party is supposed to start at six P.M., right?
(A) I added her name to the guest list. → Incorrect (unrelated to the start time)
(B) No, the invitation said seven. → Correct (corrects the party start time)
(C) Because the party decorations were expensive. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Does the manager want us to pick up the supplies or have them delivered?
(A) She'll be here soon. → Incorrect (unrelated to the supplies)
(B) You dropped your pen. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) You're right about that. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
Note: No correct answer provided; correct answer should be, e.g., 'She prefers delivery.'

28. Has Jacob come into the office today?
(A) His briefcase is on his desk. → Correct (implies Jacob is in the office)
(B) Yes, it is a nice office. → Incorrect (unrelated to Jacob's presence)
(C) I can come in for just a minute. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. Are you joining the team for today's briefing?
(A) My top client is in town. → Correct (implies unavailability for the briefing)
(B) Vittorio's Pizzeria. → Incorrect (unrelated to the briefing)
(C) I enjoyed that film. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

30. I'm organizing a healthy eating program at the office.
(A) She studied at that theater program. → Incorrect (unrelated to the eating program)
(B) Right beside the new projector. → Incorrect (refers to location, not the program)
(C) Do you need any help with it? → Correct (offers assistance with the program)

31. Is your car expensive to repair?
(A) The largest model available. → Incorrect (refers to car size, not repair cost)
(B) Only a few more times. → Incorrect (unrelated to repair cost)
(C) It's been running perfectly since I bought it. → Correct (implies low repair costs)
